Method Detail

setCurrentDirectory

public void setCurrentDirectory(java.lang.String pathname)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: DirectoryTreeStorer
sets the current directory. if pathname begins with '/', the operation is relative to the root of this tree, otherwise the operation is relative to the current directory. new files and directories will be made relative to the current directory.

Specified by:
setCurrentDirectory in interface DirectoryTreeStorer
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pathname is ill-formed or doesn't exist

createFile

public java.io.OutputStream createFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                       boolean compressItIfYouGotIt)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: DirectoryTreeStorer
creates a file with the given filename. the path will be determined by the current directory, and should not be specified in filename. if compressItIfYouGotIt is true, then the Storer should compress this data if it is capable of doing so. compressItIfYouGotIt should be false for formats that are already compressed, such as .png and .mp3.

Specified by:
createFile in interface DirectoryTreeStorer
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filename is ill-formed
java.io.IOException

keepFile

public void keepFile(java.lang.String filename)
              throws KeepFileNotSupportedException
Description copied from interface: DirectoryTreeStorer
indicates to the Storer that the given file should be retained in the store as is. Storers that support keepFile() should make a cleanup pass on close() that removes any files that were not either written with createFile() or indicated as keepers with keepFile().

Specified by:
keepFile in interface DirectoryTreeStorer
Throws:
KeepFileNotSupportedException - if keepFile() cannot be used with this Storer

isKeepFileSupported

public boolean isKeepFileSupported()
Description copied from interface: DirectoryTreeStorer
if true, then this DirectoryTreeStorer supports the keepFile() and getKeepKey() methods

Specified by:
isKeepFileSupported in interface DirectoryTreeStorer
